course.subject: ENGG
course.name: Designing Your Life for Engineering Students
course.description: Originated from Stanford University’s Life Design Lab (Bill Burnett and Dave Evans), this course employs a method called “design thinking” to help students from any program develop a constructive and effective approach to finding and designing their vocation after university. Through small group discussions, in-class activities, personal reflections and individual coaching, this course teaches students to use design thinking to explore many of life’s major challenges, such as pursuing careers they love and finding personal fulfillment. Topics include the integration of work and worldviews, ideation techniques, a portfolio approach to thriving, designing to increase balance and energy and how to prototype all aspects of students’ life. The course also touches on the realities of engaging the workplace, and practices that support vocation formation throughout the career of students. The capstone assignment is the creation of an “Odyssey Plan” focusing on taking actions in the 3-5 years following their graduation. For Engineering students only. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: 姜伯約
reviews.comment_content:
探討人生的生命教育課
唔駛背野
教你思考和規劃人生
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂會叫你有討論不同話題＋互相給意見，不多講書
中間會有休息
上堂會有片睇＋播輕鬆音樂
reviews.comment_grading:
你有一次機會預先通知無理由缺席
多過一次即F (當然病假唔計），所以不能走堂
上齊堂＋交幾篇文即得1cred
reviews.comment_workload:
寫三篇300字的文 上齊堂就行
workload可以忽略不計

reviews.author: Dav
reviews.comment_content: Constructive and interactive course content that certainly could be insightful. Could be a time for relaxation and self-reflection, or could perhaps become a networking event as you get to know your tiny group of coursemates and instructors.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not much teaching except some design thinking content, mostly interactive sessions and mini activities. Instructors and students are open to share any thoughts in the meantime. The activities are well designed and as I said could be insightful.
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F based on very simple assignments and attendance. Students are required almost full attendance so keep in mind your schedule.

No exams whatsoever, no mid terms no final exams.
reviews.comment_workload:
On a 'bad' day, maximum 20-30 minutes self reflective writing, which will be then discussed during class, before you submit the assignment. Practically one and a half week time for a simple self beneficial task.

On a good day, nothing at all.

reviews.author: _ahin_
reviews.title: Good Course, Provides for introspection and you earn one credit
reviews.comment_content: Presentations, group discussions and video analysis. Mostly talking about your future and analyzing productivity.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is nice and the classes are pleasant. If you like interactive learning the environment is good. Lectures are around 1:30- 2:00 hours long.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is Pass/Fail as long as you attend all the lectures (ONLY 1 excused absence is allowed per semester to pass)  and submit the assignments you're good!

Assignment: Each week you have to submit a 350 essay on the given topic on canva and the contents will be discussed next week during class
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy at all, maybe 20 mins a week for the short write-up assignment. Totally manageable
